title: How to summarize an essay - Quora

response.answer_text: If you have an esaay, consider the point of each paragraph. Make a bullet point about it—a few words that cover the point of that one paragraph. Then the next, and so on. Then back up and look at how each bullet point relates to the next. That can make it a bit easier to see the overall direction of a thought across a paragraph. And for longer passages, do the same: find the thrust of each paragraph, and take those to see how they are building up an argument or idea. Every sentence and every paragraph each serve a function. When you find out what each does, it makes it easier to see how they work together. Essentially, remove all eloquence and articulation.

There are two basic types of summaries: a reader summary, that you compose to develop a better understanding of what you have read, or a summary essay, which is written for others and is an overview of an original text. The point of writing a summary essay is to convey an understanding of the essence of a source text to readers, without them having to read it in its entirety.
